dt: {bc}to stop, seize, or {a_link|interrupt} in progress or course or before arrival
{bc}to receive (a communication or signal directed elsewhere) usually secretly
{bc}to intercept a pass thrown by (an opponent)
{bc}to include (part of a curve, surface, or solid) between two points, curves, or surfaces

dt.t: the part of a circumference {wi}intercepted{/wi} between two radii

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}interceptus{/it}, past participle of {it}intercipere{/it}, from {it}inter-{/it} + {it}capere{/it} to take, seize {ma}{mat|heave:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to stop, seize, or interrupt in progress or course or before arrival
to receive (a communication or signal directed elsewhere) usually secretly
to gain possession of (an opponent's pass)
